content.title: 「私は間違ったことはありませんでした」：AshtonはInformer 3838のスキャンダルの中で確固たる地位を築いています

content.desc: Former homicide squad detective Ron Iddles says up to 15 senior police officers turned a blind eye to the consequences of using a criminal barrister as an ...

content.desc: Victoria Police Commissioner Graham Ashton said he expects he will be called to testify at a royal commission into Informer 3838.

content.desc: Victoria Police Chief Commissioner Graham Ashton said police will cooperate with a royal commission into the force's use of a criminal defence lawyer as an ...

content.title: 弁護士Xのねじれ正義の物語 - オーストラリア人
content.desc: To look at him, you’d never know he was a killer. A neat, bespectacled, soft-spoken man, he had none of the bogan bravado that coursed through Melbourne’s gangland. That’s what made him so scary. As defence lawyer Zarah Garde-Wilson tells Inquirer: “If he knocked on your door to say he was there to fix your Foxtel, you would let him in in a split second.” Don’t be fooled. Even within the bloodthirsty context of the gangland war, “Cable Guy” was a particularly nasty piece of work. He was involved in the executions of three people, all carried out in full view of children: Jason Moran and Pas...

content.title: ギャングスター、警官、弁護士X：オーストラリアに衝撃を与えた警察諜報事務所 -  The Guardian
content.desc: In 2005, eight years after the murder of the underworld figure Alphonse Gangitano kicked off a long and bloody gangland war on the streets of Melbourne, a prominent criminal barrister agreed to become a registered police informant in exchange for a promise that her identity would be kept secret. The woman – known variously as Lawyer X, EF, and informer 3838 – had represented some of the gangland war’s most infamous figures, including Carl Williams and Tony Mokbel. If EF exposes herself to risk by not entering the witness protection program, she will be bound by the consequences High court r...

content.title: Roberta Williams：弁護士XがCarlを海外に逃げさせる -  The Advertiser
content.desc: She says that in 2004, after a meeting with Lawyer X, Williams told her the lawyer had “said that I should f--- off overseas”. He then said: “I’m going to get pinched. What should I stay here for?” But Roberta Williams, who says she had then been unaware of the extent of his criminality, talked him out of absconding. PT 1: HOW LAWYER X SHAPED MELBOURNE’S GANGLAND WAR FAT TONY’S BIG BASH: LAST DRINKS BEFORE ARRESTS TONY MOKBEL: I WAS URGED TO FLEE Williams was ultimately bashed to death with an exercise bike stem in Barwon jail, where he was serving a 35-year sentence for four murders. The H...

content.title: ビクトリアは、潜在的に汚染されたギャングランドの有罪判決に王室委員会を発表する -  ABC News
content.desc: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews has announced a royal commission into a number of gangland convictions which could be appealed due to the use by police of a criminal defence lawyer as an informant. The informant was a criminal defence barrister for several people who were convicted of criminal offences over the past two decades. At the same time, the barrister acted as an informant to Victoria Police about some of these people. The announcement of a royal commission followed the lifting of suppression orders this morning on a case decided in the High Court last month involving Victoria Pol...

content.title: 下に行く：警察の情報提供者として暴露された弁護士は100sの有罪判決を危険にさらしている -  RT
content.desc: Hundreds of Australian criminals, including a gangland kingpin, could now walk free after it was revealed that their defense lawyer was leaking confidential information as a police informant. Court documents published online Monday show that the lawyer, referred to only as EF, operated as a police informant between 2005-2009 under the codename 3838. EF kept in daily touch with police handlers who then passed on the information to task forces. The shocking revelations follow a secret two-year high court battle that ended last month, where Victoria Police had attempted to block state prosecut...
